name: reacclimate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to acclimate (= change to suit different conditions of life, weather, etc.) again, especially after a period of time in a different place or situation, or to help a person or an animal do this: One soldier spoke of how he and his family would have to reacclimate to each other when he was back home. It takes just a little bit longer for those who have been in space for six months to re-acclimate to gravity and re-adapt to being on Earth again. The animals were reacclimatized to outdoor temperatures before release.
More examplesFewer examplesThe company wants to help women reacclimate to their careers after spending several years raising young children.I've had just two days to re-acclimate to regular work again.We'll need to slowly reacclimate ourselves to reality.
